entries.title: What ‘No’ on F-16 Fighter Jets Might Mean for Ukraine
entries.description: If the usual script plays out, the Biden administration’s reluctance to provide the planes could be temporary, officials say.

entries.title: How an American Veterans Group Imploded in Ukraine
entries.description: The Mozart Group was training Ukrainian soldiers and evacuating frontline residents until the money ran out. Its collapse sheds light on the stresses faced by such groups.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing: Rising Militancy in Pakistan
entries.description: Also, Adani Enterprises pulls its offering and soldiers die on both sides in Bakhmut.

entries.title: A Couple Danced in Tehran’s Streets. Now They Are in Prison.
entries.description: Iranian authorities sentenced a young couple to five years in prison after they posted a video of themselves dancing in the streets at the height of the country’s protests.

entries.title: Why Iran’s Missile Program Alarms Its Regional Rivals
entries.description: A drone attack on a military facility in central Iran, said to be the work of Israel’s intelligence agency, focused renewed attention on Tehran’s advancing missile capabilities.

entries.title: Russian Troop Buildup Signals Big New Assault, Ukraine Says
entries.description: Russia is massing hundreds of thousands of troops and stepping up its bombardment, perhaps signaling the biggest assault since the start of the war. “I think it has started,” Ukraine’s leader says.

entries.title: Navalny Says He Is Being Further Isolated in Russian Prison
entries.description: “Even maniacs and serial killers serving life sentences have the right to receive a visit, but I don’t,” the Russian opposition leader wrote on Twitter.

entries.title: India’s Right Wing Tried to Scuttle the Film ‘Pathaan.’ Fans Helped It Set Records.
entries.description: “Pathaan” demonstrated the crosscutting appeal of the Bollywood titan Shah Rukh Khan, who re-emerged on the big screen after a difficult personal period.

entries.title: Policing the Wrong Way
entries.description: Memphis’s Scorpion is the latest special police unit to come under scrutiny.

entries.title: Heavier Russian Attacks Suggest Opening Moves of New Offensive, Ukraine Says
entries.description: A surge in Russian artillery barrages and a buildup of troops could be the beginning of a new push by Moscow in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine, President Zelensky says.

entries.title: Radioactive Capsule Is Found in Australia After 6-Day Search
entries.description: The authorities had feared it would take weeks to scour hundreds of miles of an Australian desert for the pea-sized device.

entries.title: Asia Is Loosening Rules on Masks. Here’s Why People Still Wear Them.
entries.description: Many other countries dropped pandemic mask requirements months ago. But in places like South Korea, which got rid of its rule this week, masks remain common.

entries.title: Covid Vaccine Makers Kept Prepayments for Canceled Shots for Poor Nations
entries.description: Separately, Johnson & Johnson is demanding additional payment for unwanted shots, confidential documents show.

entries.title: Space and Astronomy in February: What to Expect
entries.description: The shortest month of 2023 will have plenty of highlights in orbit and beyond.

entries.title: Pope Francis, in Africa, Urges an End to Congo’s Cycle of Violence
entries.description: Francis began the second day of his visit to the continent with a direct appeal to the warring groups in the Democratic Republic of Congo to put down their weapons and forgive one another.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: Europe’s economic recovery.

entries.title: Administration Expected to Endorse Limited Drilling in Alaska Project
entries.description: An environmental review expected soon would effectively signal that the Willow project proceed, according to people familiar with the report.

entries.title: Russia Floods Ukrainian City of Bakhmut With Troops
entries.description: The battle in the eastern Ukraine city of Bakhmut is growing in importance, as both sides pour forces into the battle.

entries.title: U.S. Charges Four in Connection With the Assassination of Haiti’s President
entries.description: The decision to charge the men, considered to be ringleaders in the assassination plot, in the United States is an indication of the chronic dysfunction of the Haitian justice system.

entries.title: Air Force Says Proposed Chinese-Owned Mill in North Dakota Is ‘Significant Threat’
entries.description: A proposal for a corn mill, which had been welcomed as an economic development success, reflects just how much things have changed with Chinese investment proposals in the U.S.
